comments.commentBody:
You haven't even asked the question--how much is their pension?
Many of those pensions were based on 9% returns. The average American doesn't understand simple investment math, and it's reassuring to see that Actuaries are like Lawyers...devoid of a conscience/ethics/morality/common sense...but highly paid.

“We are concerned that we see many public-sector plans using practices that have not been used by private-sector plans, or that have been abandoned by private-sector plans around the world,” Mr. Cramer said.

So what else do you expect? Where else does it matter not what the actual quality/value of work that an employee does but rather the time spent/seniority. Where else does an incompetent civil servant keep rising up the ranks with more pay? Why in a union of course. Makes no difference if you are the greatest employee - last in first out which is the union way of course. Why? Because it is the UNION!

Daily Kos is no more a reliable source than the right wing blogs.

The traditional cable TV business is going away. There is no margin in it anymore. The content providers have squeezed it all out. Broadband is a better business to be in. Comcast, Verizon, AT&T et al are embracing over-the-top.

You are right that the core of the problem is "peer refuses to augment capacity". Actually, it's "peer refuses to augment capacity without compensation". Somebody has to pay for all that capacity. Settlement free peering in the Internet has always been predicated on roughly balanced traffic. Netflix (and their transit providers) are highly imbalanced. They're trying to foist off part of the cost of their growth onto the ISPs, while retaining the profits. Demanding that the government do something about it is bald-faced rent seeking.

Slann, Wheeler LEFT a high paying job in the industry for a much lower paying one in government, not the other way around, such as Cantor et. al after he was forced out.

Your comment about the 'revolving door' here about Wheeler doesn't make sense.

The career of ex-politicians, including their staffers, is usually just in one direction......becoming a highly paid lobbyists using their good connections to their old buddies in Congress to profit the industries they are lobbying for.
Who says ASU will be playing Oregon in the Pac-12 Championship game? - You gotta get by UA in the Territorial Bowl, first, Sparky (wink)! GREAT win against The Irish.

If Arizona State beats Oregon in the Pac 12 championship and moves into the top 4, Notre Dame fans will be back here telling us how they beat Florida State and outplayed Arizona State, and deserve to play for the championship.

CrabbyTom IN NC, your source shows Norway's download speed about 5.7% faster than the US. For a service speed that has been growing exponentially is a few percent that big of a deal? Are we really willing to risk giving up the rate of improvement for regulations of dubious need?

Also, regarding your other comment, do you understand that ISPs do not have the ability to provide every customer max bandwidth 24/7? If they did, you could not possibly afford it. Just like stadiums don't have enough bathrooms for everyone to go simultaneously, ISPs don't have enough pipe to max everyone out at the same time.

There's nothing wrong with trying to sell the domain name.  It's when they veer into malicious redirects, mockery, and close to slander, that they lose any semblance of being honest business people and more like pirates.

He's welcome to do that, and maybe Ms. Hill should lower her price if she wants to sell. That said, do you find it odd that you're taking the side of the oligarch who certainly doesn't need the money? When you're negotiating with a billionaire, go for every penny you can get.
Last time I looked this was still America. Remember, 'Greed is good,' a sentiment one sees in action every day.

I'm no fan of Russian Oligarchs either, but the motive of the Hill's is greed and their asking price for the domain outrageous. If I were Prokhorov I'd simply leave it as BrookylnNets.com. The Brooklyn name has more panache anyway. "Take your Nets.com" and stuff it!

Third and final morning puzzle of Arlington Puzzle Festival. Personal goal of under 6, but I think I barely got it under 7 (another case of looking up only a few seconds before the top of the minute and deciding to go for it). The immediate Google this time was Georges PEREC, though the theme made me pretty sure it was correct.

Pretty sure I tried COD for PPD, ON END (adj.) for PUT UP (v.), and MONORAIL for HORSE CAR. Also, DECA for DECI. Stumped on a shade of brown for M----, and I was stuck on spelling or quilting for the cross-referenced BEE. In the end, I guess I made enough inexorable progress to come out OK. When they read the names of the three finalists after lunch, mine came first alphabetically, but I think I may also have been the fastest overall.

Tomorrow, the final....

Thanks Stephen, for beating me to it! So very, very true!!

Today, in the economics of the two parties there is nothing more direct for comparison. In California, Democrats take control, elect a liberal Governor, and raise taxes slightly, and the state's economy is booming, one of the best in the nation!
By contrast, in Kansas Republicans tighten their hold, elect a rightwing extremist Republican Governor, and cut taxes dramatically. Result? The state's economy is in a shambles, it's credit rating downgraded by both major rating agencies, and the state's own non-partisan auditing agency is projecting a steadily worsening financial situation with every update!

Nothing could do a better job of demonstrating Republican economics (failed!) versus Democratic economics (success!).

One thought provoking question to the experts of the climate science. Is it possible to contain the pollution from emission within the country of the source?
Indeed, Pollution from China, America, India or any other country, it has an adverse effects globally. The secret agreement on the control measure to be adopted between the world's number one and two polluters make it farce especially America, the symbol of democratic values in the world that will always try to justify its actions in any part of the world is for the welfare of the people in that country .
It is unbelievable for any person who has high regards for Mr.Obama who has
gone for a secret deal with China on the measures to be followed on Climate change.
Climate change by carbon emission doesn't need a clandestine approach but a candid discussion in presence of the others to follow the suit.
In the field of Science only fact rules but here the secret starts ruling.

Who really cares about what the republicans say?
The measly voting numbers show no one has confidence in them, either.

Obama intends to 'double down' on job-crushing policies - it is a crusade' against affordable energy - Boehner said.

Mcconnell says Obama emissions target 'unrealistic'!

So China made a "deal" to continue on its current course till 2030?

What will the Republicans say and do now?

if China has an economic incentive to convert to low carbon energy like their current low cost solar panel manufacturing capabilities, then absolutely China has strong and real incentives to implement alternative energies, both domestically and internationally.

The Chinese are 'playing' Obama.  How about reducing 'Real Pollution' such as sulfur and nitrogen compounds along with Mercury and fine particulate matter, etc. Have you seen the air in Beijing lately.  That is filth, not CO2, for crissakes. The Chinese will not even spend money to install coal 'scrubbers'. Does any sane individual really think they will use less efficient and more expensive 'Alternative Energy'? Really?

It is EXACTLY this type of hyper partisan hyperbole that led to the midterm election results in 2010 and 2014. So disgraceful. Republicans are all racists who are engaged in genocide. Have you no shame sir?

pj: The shame is to be equally shared. Go over to some of the sites hosting mainly Republicans if you want to read some hair-burning hateful remarks about "stupid" Democrats. If you're unhappy here, you should be very happy there - they're even worse than the remark you just squawked over. Much worse.

In fact, we're pretty tame compared to the "winnning" Republicans! What makes them so mean and hateful even in victory? I'd like to know. Well, not really.

Lyndon Johnson declared war on poverty. Ronald Reagan changed that to war on the poor. Now the Republican Party is waging a surge in this war, attempting to take health care insurance away from more than 5 million Americans by repealing the Affordable Care Act -- at a cost of 10,000 premature deaths per million uninsured; that is, premature deaths for more than 50,000 Americans.

At what point does "genocide" become the operative word?

First net neutrality and now global warming: there seems to be something about having no more elections to worry about that has motivated Obama to try and accomplish some good in his last two years. On the whole, I think he's a horrible disappointment, but if he wants to accomplish some worthwhile things before he leaves office, that's fine with me.

END ORSE

The cockney nag, "orse," is great.
Of course!  Thanks!  I was sure the word mare was in there, and my knowledge of Cockney slang is not all that great so for a while I had "madarme" which I don't think is a word.

I got everything, or so I thought, until I read the comments and realized I had a couple wrong.  For 22D I had prompt for "on time" with Pop =father.  I see now that priest makes more sense.  Also I had "showtunes" for 18A instead of "sporting.". What I can't figure out is 27A.  Can anyone clue me in?

Probably the best deal that COULD be achieved. Unfortunately, the article did not present numbers like per capita emissions in the US and China. Maybe additional articles will.

Will this accord influence India?

Does this accord require approval by the Republican Congress?

Yes, Sarah!  Don't you love those who dance around climate change by saying, "I'm not a scientist," but don't hesitate to discredit the warnings of actual scientists, like they were all conspiring against the GOP and American businesses?!

This is some incredible announcement.  To meet this agreement, within 15 years China will increase their level of nuclear, wind and solar power generation equivalent to the combined electrical production in the USA today.  What an unbelievable wonder!!

You need to consider per-capita emissions.  On a per-person basis, people in the United States emit more than twice as much carbon as people in China.  Even while Chinese emissions continue to grow and U.S. emissions drop, the average American will still be responsible for more emissions than the average Chinese.

How do you suggest that the notion of climate change is fabricated by private interests and totally ignore the massive incentives for the fossil fuel industry to make us believe it's all a hoax?

What's scarier about your position is the fact that China will make progress on this. They're dealing with a very real smog problem and they know that green energy is long term more economical. If we fail to move, the next great energy innovation is going to happen in China not here. We'll be continuing to spend for an ever dwindling supply of oil while the Chinese create a massive economy on cheap, renewable energy.

Cheap imports from China will certainly deal a blow to the labor force working in the import industry.

But what is overlooked in your argument is that imported goods bring benefits to American consumers, allowing them to purchase consumer goods, like daily necessities, at much cheaper prices, lowering the overall level of consumer prices in the United States.

Another merit is that many imported intermediate goods also lower prices of complete goods manufactured in the United States, strenghtening price competitiveness of American exports, and increasing their overseas sales.
They should definitely ratify this deal. It is important to reduce carbon emissions in the US and China to inspire other coutries.
"Symbolic nonsense." That's exactly right, I'm afraid.
Wasn't it the GOP Senate that failed to ratify Kyoto thereby sealing its fate around the world?

Silly, symbolic nonsense. I am disappointed by the reader comments to this story, many of which bemoan that the Republicans in the U.S. Congress will not pass this agreement. That is entirely beside the point. When the original Kyoto agreement expired in 2012, most of the participating countries *refused* to adopt a new agreement -- mainly because the original Kyoto proved costly and unpopular (and accomplished little). It astonishes me what the Left think is possible in this world. It is also quite callous to be wasting time on this nonsense when there are very real threats to people worldwide, such as the lack of potable water and vaccinations. But, yes, the GOP (and even some Dems) in Congress will most likely not ratify this agreement. Nor should they.

It's not a formal treaty, it doesn't need to be approved by the Senate. Obama (and hopefully our next Democratic president) will use issue regulations under existing legal authority to reduce emissions.  It's a Republican President that could wreak everything.

You need to do a little research. Look up things like Power Density and Energy Density.  'Alternative or Renewable Energy' can not replace fossil fuels nor should they.  CO2 has never, ever been shown to increase the planet's temperature.  According to accurate satellite measurements, not the Alarmists reporting of the 'Hottest Year' nonsense, there has been no 'Global Warming' for 18 years.  The IPCC's computers (the crystal ball) gave such a scenario a 'Near Zero Probability.  Knowledge-- It's all out there, and easier than ever to find.  You just cannot be afraid to look.
Tom, we will lose our interest in the Middle East and their ability to pull us into their problems when we cease to be addicted to their oil.
You  said   it  well,  Mr.  Hirons.   That's   exactly   why   the  fights   between  Sunnis  and   Shiites  are  even  mentioned   at  all   in  the   U.S.  media.

"Just let it be" is a nice way of saying: "let innocent people be oppressed, beheaded, forced into sex slavery, and live in constant fear because their beliefs differ from ISIS."

We can keep bashing the US for past mistakes in the Middle East, but the fact remains that stopping ISIS's rampage is a moral necessity and should be fully supported. Unless you subscribe to the "let god sort it out" stance, which is, of course, naive and morally bankrupt.

Mr. Friedman and Mr. Freud we are in the Middle East because the US military is so big it needs something to do. We don't need the oil. We don't need their culture, we don't need their religion and we don't need their problems. What we need is a place for our military to play. The US Military likes to fight and Middle East provides a playground for them to play war games.

Nah, I am a Nam vet. Pull out today and nobody cares about the Middle East two weeks from now. Just let it be buddy, let it be.
